9.26.17  2:52 am   Ever since I learned about the Maj7 chord I've never gone back to using just the major triad by itself anymore, unless it's part of a slash chord. Then when I learned about the Maj9 chord, I've never gone back to the Maj7 chord. Is this a problem?

      Should I try to use more simple triads?
9.26.17  1:43 am   What do you think about pigeons?

9.26.17  1:27 am   writing the music is the real fun part for me, just laying down the chords and instrumentation. i like it! but 40 instrumental songs later, it feels like i'm in the same place as when i began--my skills are better, but i haven't gotten to say anything, and i need to move forwards. i've made 3 songs with words, and it's important. they were good, except recording vocals drives me crazy so the production value on that is subpar.
you've really gotta have words if you wanna be clear and specific in your meaning. but lyrics only come to me sometimes, one idea at a time, and in between i'm left drifting. again, putting words to music is some of the most fun i've had making anything. but i really don't know how to just get jumpstarted at will. how can i conquer this?
9.26.17  1:18 am   Whats your favorite time period?

9.26.17  12:53 am   Do you see your whole life as a song?

     Choose the things you do according to the beat of a rhythm or a purpose? Then bounce around that theme randomly to try to explore all possibilities and find unexpected ways to express yourself? Listening to your music has made me start to act this way, and I think I like it, although I'm still being cautious. If your art has this effect on me, I wonder what effect the other media I consume has on my mental and emotional equilibrium. I want to use this realization as an excuse to control my mental faculties and inputs, while I also try to remind myself that if I fall too deep down that hole I will miss out on some really cool/interesting shit. Sometimes you've gotta experience the universe, sometimes you've gotta think about it, but whichever you're doing right now you should do it in a way that builds it for the future AND enjoys the present.
